body.p: This version of the emulator includes support to send screen to e-mail.

ol.li:
Download the e-mail api's from sun. You will need two packages.
http://java.sun.com/products/javamail/
http://java.sun.com/products/javabeans/glasgow/jaf.html
Unzip the files into there respective directories. I use the same directory names as provided within the zip files.

section.title: Deployment
section.p: Copy the file activation.jar from the /jaf-1.0.1 file to the SAME DIRECTORY as the tn5250j.jar.
to the SAME DIRECTORY as the tn5250j.jar.
If you list the directory where the tn5250j.jar file is you should see 4 files with the extension .jar. If this is not true then go to step one of Deployment and start again.

section.title: Configure E- mail

p.strong: Step 1 - Start E-Mail by hitting the Alt-E or selecting from popup menu

section.p: You can select one of the two menu items from Send Screen

p.strong: Step 2 - You will then be presented with the following dialog

section.p: Select Configure from the row of buttons at the bottom of the dialog

p.strong: Step 3 - Fill in the values on SMTP Properties Configuration dialog

tr.td: Fill in the host name or ip address of your SMTP mail server.
Fill in the port to use to connect
This is the e-mail address from. For example I would place kjpou@hotmail.com here as follows: mail.smtp.from=kjpou@hotmail.com
The name to use as the attachement that will be sent.

p.strong: Step 4 - Click the left button labeled Done

section.p: You will then be brought back to the Send E-Mail dialog. Here the Configure button will be changed to Edit Config showing that the information was saved and is now available for editing and all should be ready to send.

p.strong: Step 5 - Fill in the information on the screen

section.p: When finished filling in the information on the screen click the button, marked Send, on left from the row of buttons at the bottom of the dialog.
You should now have successfully sent the message.

section.title: Deployment with JavaWebStart
section.p: Using the webstart application the clients are automatically set up for use any any changes are automatically downloaded and ready for use.
I also have scripts and or .bat set up to do the signing and copying to the intranet.
I have included my sample .jnlp file that I use for deploying in JavaWebStart.
